file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-10-10-04 - MAIN SIDE-STRUT CARDAN JOINT OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN SIDE-STRUT CARDAN JOINT OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the main side-strut cardan joint of the main landing gear. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY MAIN SIDE-STRUT CARDAN JOINT OF ALL 32-10-10-000-801-A THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL MAIN SIDE-STRUT CARDAN JOINT OF ALL 32-10-10-400-801-A THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - INSTALLA- TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-10-10 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-10-10-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. MAIN SIDE-STRUT CARDAN JOINT OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the main side-strut cardan joint of the main landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION (TASK 52-12-02-000-801-A) - AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH or LH Main Landing Gear 1 Helps the other technician RH or LH Main Landing Gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open, safety, and tag (DO NOT CLOSE) the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker. (2) Make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200. (3) Make sure that the safety pins of the landing gears are installed AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-10 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Lift the aircraft on jacks. AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200. (5) Release the pressure from the MLG Pax - Door ACCUM (TASK 52-12-02-000-801-A). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) To remove the cardan joint (3), do as follows: (a) Release the cardan joint (3) from the upper end of the MLG actuator (6) as follows: 1 Remove the cotter pin (7), nut (8), washer (9), and pivot (10). (b) Release the cardan joint (3) from the main side strut (14) as follows: 1 Remove the locking washer (5) and the washer (4). (c) Remove the hollow pin (15) from the wing structure (1) to release the cardan joint (3) as follows: 1 Remove the cotter pin (11), nut (12), washers (13) and (16), and bolt (17). 2 Remove the hollow pin (15) and bushing (2). (d) Remove the cardan joint (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-10 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Main Side-Strut Cardan Joint of the Main Landing Gear - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B MLG ACTUATOR C A ZONES 721 731 MAIN SIDE STRUT 1 17. BOLT 1. WING 16. WASHER STRUCTURE DET. A 1 15. HOLLOW PIN 2. BUSHING 14. MAIN SIDE STRUT 1 3. CARDAN JOINT 4. WASHER 2 5. LOCKING WASHER 1 12. NUT 13. WASHER 11. COTTERPIN DET. C 1 10. PIVOT 3. CARDAN JOINT 3 6. ACTUATOR 9. WASHER 1 CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND - COR-BAN 27L. 4 8. NUT 2 SEALANT MIL-S-8802. 7. COTTER PIN 3 AEROSHELL GREASE 22CF OR ALTERNATIVE. DET. B 4 APPLY RUN TORQUE AS NECESSARY FOR INSTALLATION OF THE COTTER PIN EM145AMM320679A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-10 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-10-10-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. MAIN SIDE-STRUT CARDAN JOINT OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the main side-strut and the actuator cardan joint of the main landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200 - LANDING GEAR AND MAIN DOOR ACCUMULATOR - AMM TASK 12-13-06-600-801-A/300 CHARGE EXTENSION AND RETRACTION SYSTEM - OPERA- AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500 TIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 32-34-00-600-801-A/300 MLG AND NLG - LUBRICATION LG EMERGENCY EXTENSION - OPERATIONAL AND AMM TASK 32-34-00-700-801-A/500 FUNCTIONAL CHECKS C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Resistant to Phosphate For protection of the hands 2 available Ester-Base Fluid Commercially Rubber Goggles, Resistant to Phos- For protection of the eyes 2 available phate Ester-Base Fluid Commercially Soft Lint-Free Cloth To clean the components AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR MIL-S-8802 TYPE II, Class B2 Sealant AR MIL-PRF-81322 Aeroshell Grease 22 AR MIL-PRF-23827 Aeroshell Grease 33 (alternative to Aeroshell 22) AR MEP 13-073 Rhodiasolve E-23 AR MS24665-134 Cotter pin 1 MS 24665-357 Cotter pin 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-10 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH or LH Main Landing Gear 1 Helps the other technician RH or LH Main Landing Gear I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION:AEROSHELL GREASE 22 MUST NOT BE MIXED WITH AEROSHELL GREASE 33. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS PRECAUTION, THE MIXTURE CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE COMPONENTS. (1) Use a dry lint-free cloth to remove excess old grease from the components as necessary. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING. DO NOT BREATHE THE SOLVENT GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (2) With a cloth soaked in Rhodiasolve E-23, clean the remaining grease from the components as necessary. WARNING: COR-BAN 27L CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE GLOVES. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (3) Apply COR-BAN 27L to the hollow pin (15) and install it to attach the upper end of the main side strut (14) to the support at the wing structure (1). (4) Put the bushing (2) and the cardan joint (3) on the hollow pin (15) with COR-BAN 27L. (5) Install the washer (4) and the locking washer (5). (6) Align the hole of the main side strut (14) and the hole of the hollow pin (15) and install the bolt (17) with COR-BAN 27L, the washers (16) and (13), nut (12), and cotter pin (11). (7) Apply COR-BAN 27L to the pivot (10) and install the main landing-gear actuator (6) to the cardan joint (3) as follows: (a) Put the upper end of the main landing gear actuator (6) aligned with the cardan joint (3). (b) Install the pivot (10), washer (9), nut (8), and cotter pin (7). (8) Apply sealant MIL-S-8802 to the locking washer (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-10 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on (Figure 401) SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Pressurize the MLG Pax - Door ACCUM AMM TASK 12-13-06-600-801-A/300. (2) Lubricate the main side strut AMM TASK 32-34-00-600-801-A/300. CAUTION:AEROSHELL GREASE 22 MUST NOT BE MIXED WITH AEROSHELL GREASE 33. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS PRECAUTION, THE MIXTURE CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE COMPONENTS. (3) Lubricate the rod end of the actuator with the same grease as the one used to lubricate the main side strut. (4) On the circuit breaker panel, unsafety, untag, and close the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker, as applicable. (5) Energize the aircraft. (6) Remove the safety pins from the landing gears. (7) Do an operational check of the MLG AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500. (8) Do the functional check of the landing gear free-fall system AMM TASK 32-34-00-700-801-A/500. (9) Lower the aircraft and remove the jacks AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-10 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
